issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
Current windows (ebs backed, will update with instance store) tests are failing to get password. The image is a large 17G Win8 image running in KVM. Instance is up and responding to ping and RDP. 


Euca2ools error:
{code}
[root@b-02 ~]# euca-get-password -k test.pem  i-888744E6 --debug
2013-09-26 11:50:58,029 DEBUG   GetPasswordData parsed arguments: {'userregion': None, 'shell_configfile': '', 'InstanceId': 'i-888744E6', 'priv_launch_key': 'test.pem', 'url': None, 'deprecated_sec_key': None, 'deprecated_key_id': None, 'show_empty_fields': False, 'key_id': None, 'secret_key': None}
2013-09-26 11:50:58,030 DEBUG   Config searching regions for option 'ec2-url'

2013-09-26 11:50:58,036 DEBUG   EC2CompatibleQuerySigV2Auth converting params to POST data

2013-09-26 11:50:58,046 DEBUG   Eucalyptus request data:   Action: GetPasswordData

{code}

Eutester boto error:

/Library/Python/2.7/site-packages/eutester-0.0.8-py2.7.egg/eucaops/ec2ops.pyc in get_windows_instance_password(self, instance, private_key_path, key, dir, exten, encoded)

-> 3831         return rs.passwordData
   3832

{code}

{code}

RESERVATION	r-EAC8423B	832486915720	test

comments.body: [~mclark] is the emi windows platform? If so, I think the bug is that we don't return the proper error with get-password call..

Hi [~spark], 
Platform is None in this case. Thanks good catch, I missed that. 
Looks like there's typo in eutester causing the kernel id at registration to remain blank and not set to 'windows', now fixed. 
Agree, a more informative error would be helpful. 
Thanks!
-Matt

I registered an EMI from given snapshot like this {code} # euca-register -n "windows2012ebs" --root-device-name /dev/sda -b /dev/sda=snap-77513E3A --arch x86_64 IMAGE emi-F121439D {code} But when I checked the platform, I found it got set to windows automatically, looks like it was because the name began with "windows" ? {code} 2013-10-14 01:53:19,943 DEBUG DescribeImages -- response content -- emi-F121439D492776843771/windows2012ebsavailable492776843771falsex86_64machinewindowswindows2012ebsebs/dev/sda/dev/sdasnap-77513E3A14truehvm 2013-10-14 01:53:19,943 DEBUG DescribeImages -- end of response content -- IMAGE emi-F121439D 492776843771/windows2012ebs 492776843771 available private x86_64 machine windows ebs hvm BLOCKDEVICEMAPPING /dev/sda snap-77513E3A 14 true {code} So Now I registered an EMI again from the same snapshot like this {code} # euca-register -n "ebs" --root-device-name /dev/sda -b /dev/sda=snap-77513E3A --arch x86_64 IMAGE emi-663042BD {code} Now the platform bit was empty as shown below {code} 2013-10-14 01:54:47,769 DEBUG DescribeImages -- response content -- emi-663042BD492776843771/ebsavailable492776843771falsex86_64machineebsebs/dev/sda/dev/sdasnap-77513E3A14truehvm 2013-10-14 01:54:47,770 DEBUG DescribeImages -- end of response content -- IMAGE emi-663042BD 492776843771/ebs 492776843771 available private x86_64 machine ebs hvm BLOCKDEVICEMAPPING /dev/sda snap-77513E3A 14 true {code} After this I ran an instance from emi-663042BD and after it went into Running state, I tried grabbing the password like this {code} # euca-get-password -k sshlogin i-D0713F22 --debug {code} Following was the output received {code} 2013-10-14 02:09:02,761 DEBUG GetPasswordData parsed arguments: {'userregion': None, 'shell_configfile': '', 'InstanceId': 'i-D0713F22', 'priv_launch_key': 'sshlogin', 'url': None, 'deprecated_sec_key': None, 'deprecated_key_id': None, 'show_empty_fields': False, 'key_id': None, 'secret_key': None} 2013-10-14 02:09:02,761 DEBUG Config searching regions for option 'ec2-url' 2013-10-14 02:09:02,761 DEBUG Config section 'aws:us-east-1' 2013-10-14 02:09:02,761 INFO Config option 'ec2-url' = 'https://ec2.us-east-1.amazonaws.com/' 2013-10-14 02:09:02,761 DEBUG Config searching regions for option 'verify-ssl' 2013-10-14 02:09:02,761 DEBUG Config section 'aws:us-east-1' 2013-10-14 02:09:02,762 DEBUG Config section 'aws:*' 2013-10-14 02:09:02,762 INFO Config option 'verify-ssl' = 'true' 2013-10-14 02:09:02,765 INFO GetPasswordData parameters: {'InstanceId': 'i-D0713F22', 'Action': 'GetPasswordData', 'Version': '2013-02-01'} 2013-10-14 02:09:02,766 INFO Eucalyptus sending request (attempt 1 of 3) 2013-10-14 02:09:02,766 DEBUG EC2CompatibleQuerySigV2Auth string to sign: 'POST\n10.104.1.210:8773\n/services/Eucalyptus\nAWSAccessKeyId=AKI4DIZ8QQWPX98KLIK2&Action=GetPasswordData&InstanceId=i-D0713F22&SignatureMethod=HmacSHA256&SignatureVersion=2&Timestamp=2013-10-14T09%3A09%3A02Z&Version=2013-02-01' 2013-10-14 02:09:02,767 DEBUG EC2CompatibleQuerySigV2Auth b64-encoded signature: FSBlRezYXDdBjTquT3dH8AaznGOkyerj37czN+4blcI= 2013-10-14 02:09:02,767 DEBUG EC2CompatibleQuerySigV2Auth converting params to POST data 2013-10-14 02:09:02,772 DEBUG Eucalyptus request method: POST 2013-10-14 02:09:02,772 DEBUG Eucalyptus request url: http://10.104.1.210:8773/services/Eucalyptus 2013-10-14 02:09:02,772 DEBUG Eucalyptus request header: Content-Length: 239 2013-10-14 02:09:02,772 DEBUG Eucalyptus request header: Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded 2013-10-14 02:09:02,772 DEBUG Eucalyptus request header: Host: 10.104.1.210:8773 2013-10-14 02:09:02,772 DEBUG Eucalyptus request header: User-Agent: euca2ools/3.0.2-18-gd640f7f (CPython 2.6.6; Linux 2.6.32-358.el6.x86_64; x86_64) requestbuilder/0.1.0-beta2 requests/1.1.0 2013-10-14 02:09:02,772 DEBUG Eucalyptus request data: AWSAccessKeyId: AKI4DIZ8QQWPX98KLIK2 2013-10-14 02:09:02,772 DEBUG Eucalyptus request data: Action: GetPasswordData 2013-10-14 02:09:02,772 DEBUG Eucalyptus request data: InstanceId: i-D0713F22 2013-10-14 02:09:02,772 DEBUG Eucalyptus request data: Signature: FSBlRezYXDdBjTquT3dH8AaznGOkyerj37czN+4blcI= 2013-10-14 02:09:02,772 DEBUG Eucalyptus request data: SignatureMethod: HmacSHA256 2013-10-14 02:09:02,772 DEBUG Eucalyptus request data: SignatureVersion: 2 2013-10-14 02:09:02,772 DEBUG Eucalyptus request data: Timestamp: 2013-10-14T09:09:02Z 2013-10-14 02:09:02,772 DEBUG Eucalyptus request data: Version: 2013-02-01 2013-10-14 02:09:02,847 DEBUG Eucalyptus response time: 0.074 seconds 2013-10-14 02:09:02,847 ERROR Eucalyptus response status: 400 2013-10-14 02:09:02,847 DEBUG Eucalyptus response header: content-length: 220 2013-10-14 02:09:02,847 DEBUG Eucalyptus response header: content-type: application/xml; charset=UTF-8 2013-10-14 02:09:02,848 DEBUG GetPasswordData -- response content -- OperationNotPermittedInstance's platform is not Windowsbee6e83a-aeb4-4a74-b105-b5292c64e0b8 2013-10-14 02:09:02,848 DEBUG GetPasswordData -- end of response content -- 2013-10-14 02:09:02,848 INFO GetPasswordData result: failure euca-get-password: error (OperationNotPermitted): Instance's platform is not Windows Traceback (most recent call last): File "/usr/bin/euca-get-password", line 5, in pkg_resources.run_script('euca2ools==3.0.2-18-gd640f7f', 'euca-get-password') File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/pkg_resources.py", line 461, in run_script self.require(requires)[0].run_script(script_name, ns) File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/pkg_resources.py", line 1194, in run_script execfile(script_filename, namespace, namespace) File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/euca2ools-3.0.2_18_gd640f7f-py2.6.egg/EGG-INFO/scripts/euca-get-password", line 6, in euca2ools.commands.euca.getpassword.GetPassword.run() File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/requestbuilder/command.py", line 288, in run cmd.handle_cli_exception(err) File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/requestbuilder/command.py", line 285, in run result = cmd.main() File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/requestbuilder/request.py", line 182, in main response = self.send() File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/requestbuilder/request.py", line 134, in send return self.handle_server_error(err) File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/requestbuilder/request.py", line 130, in send data=self.body) File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/requestbuilder/service.py", line 234, in send_request self.handle_http_error(response) File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/euca2ools-3.0.2_18_gd640f7f-py2.6.egg/euca2ools/commands/euca/__init__.py", line 204, in handle_http_error raise AWSError(response) euca2ools.exceptions.AWSError: (400, '', 'OperationNotPermitted', "Instance's platform is not Windows") {code} Hence verified that the EMIs without platform set to windows, if euca-get-password is run following error is returned {code} euca-get-password: error (OperationNotPermitted): Instance's platform is not Windows {code} Please let me know if there are any questions.
[~dshekhawat] It looks like an expected behavior. The null platform is 'linux' and that's why get-password returns error with the correct wording.
